column2: Hyster-Yale Materials Handling, Inc. engages in the manufacture of lift trucks. The company is headquartered in Cleveland, Ohio and currently employs 7,800 full-time employees. The firm designs, engineers, manufactures, sells and services a line of lift trucks, attachments and aftermarket parts marketed globally under the Hyster and Yale brand names, mainly to independent Hyster and Yale retail dealerships. The firm operates through five segments: the Americas, EMEA, JAPIC, Bolzoni and Nuvera. The firm offers a range of solutions, including attachments and hydrogen fuel cell power products, telematics, automation and fleet management services, as well as an array of other power options for its lift trucks. The firm's segments for the lift truck business include three management units: the Americas, EMEA and JAPIC. Americas includes operations in the United States, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Latin America and its corporate headquarters. EMEA includes operations in Europe, the Middle East and Africa. JAPIC includes operations in the Asia and Pacific regions including China.
